snippet: Those who favor the European Union are frustrated by the silence of business on the E.U.'s commercial benefits, when, in private, company bosses are outspoken about the risks of withdrawal.
abstract: Membership in the European Union is vital to many British businesses, yet with the public divided over Britain's ties to the block, most business leaders prefer a discreet silence to risking criticism; stakes have increased, with Prime Min David Cameron promising to loosen British ties to the bloc and possibly hold referendum after negotiating a more arm's-length relationship.
lead_paragraph: Those who favor the European Union are frustrated by the silence of business on the E.U.'s commercial benefits, when, in private, company bosses are outspoken about the risks of withdrawal.

headline.seo: British Business Hesitant to Defend Staying in European Union
headline.main: British Business Leaders Stay Silent on E.U. Exit
headline.print_headline: British Chiefs Stay Silent On E.U. Exit
